response_parsed.title: Observing REST APIs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to use the FastAPI framework to create and test RESTful APIs quickly and easily in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python.
FastAPI supports multiple python versions but this guide focuses on version 3.12+
FastAPI simplifies API development by providing automatic documentation, type hints, and openAPI support out of the box.
FastAPI is built on top of Starlette, a small and high-performance WSGW server.
FastAPI includes features such as input validation, exception handling, and routing functionality.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this example.
FastAPI requires Python >= 3.7 and ASGI (ASGI 1.0 or later) to run.
caveats: Make sure you have the necessary dependencies installed, such as FastAPI, Uvicorn, and Pydantic.
You may need to install these dependencies using pip: `pip install fastapi uvicorn python-jose[cryptography] jittor`
